markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Isqulug](/Monsters.aspx?ID=705)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The isqulug's appearance, though unsettling, might be its least awful aspect. The creature resembles a bipedal amphibian with tentacles instead of arms and a head composed of an undulant mass of what appear to be shifting, slimy transparent eggs filled with writhing larvae. In truth, these larvae constitute the mind and consciousness of the isqulug—its “body” is little more than an organic suit manufactured from the flesh of those it has consumed, analogous to the complex web of a spider or the hive of a colony of bees, but fully capable of movement and violence.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 30

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Isqulug.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 11">[Isqulug](/Monsters.aspx?ID=705)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Aberration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=1" />
<trait label="Amphibious" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=207" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 149 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +24; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), host scent 30 feet

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +22, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +24, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +22

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +5

**Con** +7

**Int** +3

**Wis** +7

**Cha** +5
</row>

**Host Scent** An isqulug can precisely sense any creature infected with isqulugia within 30 feet, and knows the current stage of the disease.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 31 [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1)

**Fort** +24 

**Ref** +20 

**Will** +18 

</row>

**HP** 230

, regeneration 10 (deactivated by cold)

**Immunities**
[swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=36)

**Resistances**
fire 10

**Weaknesses**
cold 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, swim 25 feet; swamp stride

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +22 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d12+11 bludgeoning plus isqulugia

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 30, attack +22
- **Cantrips (5th)**
[Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58)
- **Cantrips (1st)**
[Pass Without Trace](/Spells.aspx?ID=215)
- **4th**
[Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125)
- **5th**
[Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51), [Entangle](/Spells.aspx?ID=103) (at will), [Hallucinatory Terrain](/Spells.aspx?ID=145), [Obscuring Mist](/Spells.aspx?ID=210) (at will)
- **6th**
[Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331)

**Expel Infestation** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The isqulug expels larvae from the hivemind in its head in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in this area take 6d10 piercing damage as the swarm feeds on their flesh (DC 30 basic Reflex save). Any creature that takes damage is exposed to isqulugia. The isqulug becomes [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1d4 rounds, during which it can't Expel Infestation.

**Isqulugia**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157), [Virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162)) Isqulugia's [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35), and [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed; **Saving Throw** DC 30 Fortitude; **Stage 1** sickened 1 (1 hour); **Stage 2** [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) and sickened 2 (1 day); **Stage 3** fatigued and slowed 1 (1 day); **Stage 4** paralyzed (1 day); **Stage 5** the creature dies, and its body violently transforms into a new isqulug. [_Wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377), similar magic, or a 9th-level [resurrect](/Rituals.aspx?ID=20) ritual can return the victim to life. The new isqulug remains even if the victim is brought back to life.

**Malleability**   The isqulug can [Squeeze](/Actions.aspx?ID=31) through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. The isqulug can even Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for Squeezing.

**Swamp Stride**   An isqulug ignores difficult terrain that's caused by typical features of swamps.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Exiles from Beyond</title>

These disgusting parasites originally manifested in the [First World](/Planes.aspx?ID=10), but the fey denizens of that realm found them too awful to endure and exiled them to the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1). Over time, the isqulugs sloughed off their fey features for new, more powerful bodies of their own. Reports of stranger variants flourishing in areas such as [demon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28)-defiled Tanglebriar and remote fungi-ridden vaults in Orv, however, suggest their foothold on Golarion has become more established than previously thought.
</aside>
name: Isqulug
